intro: Vandellia crustacea var. verticillata, commonly known as the spiral liverwort, is a species of liverwort belonging to the family Porellaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive spiral arrangement of leaves, which gives it a unique and ornate appearance. This plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as rocky crevices or forest floors. It is a non-vascular plant, meaning it lacks true roots, stems, and leaves in the traditional sense. The plant plays an important ecological role in maintaining soil stability and providing microhabitats for various organisms.
